tab.name: Standard Options
tab.option: Filtering of data matrix or data frame. Each row must correspond to an observation, and each column must correspond to a variable. All variables must be numeric. Missing values (NAs) are allowed.
The number of clusters. It is required that 0 < clusters < n where n is the number of observations

tab.name: Advanced Options
tab.option: An integer giving the maximal number of EM iterations to be performed. Default: 100.

The minimum relative improvement of the objective function per iteration. If improvement is less, the EM algorithm will stop under the assumption that no further significant improvement can be made. Default value will be set depending on the numerical characteristics of the machine R is running on (sqrt(.Machine$double.eps)).

A specification of the starting values to be employed. Can be a character vector with elements "i" (randomly pick component ids for the observations), or one of "p", "S" or "s". The latter first determine component “prototypes”, and then determine an optimal “fuzzy” membership matrix from the implied cosine dissimilarities between observations and prototypes. Prototypes are obtained as follows: for "p", observations are randomly picked. For "S", one takes the first prototype to minimize total cosine dissimilarity to the observations, and then successively picks observations farthest away from the already picked prototypes. For "s", one takes a randomly chosen observation as the first prototype, and then proceeds as for "S". By default, initialization method "p" is used. If several starting values are specified, the EM algorithm is performed individually to each starting value, and the best solution found is returned.
An integer giving the number of EM runs to be performed. Default: 1. Only used if start is not given.

A numeric indicating the minimum prior probability. Components falling below this threshold are removed during the iteration. If >= 1, this is taken as the minimal number of observations in a component. Default: 0.

Logical, if TRUE the EM algorithm is stopped if the reltol criterion is met and the current parameter estimate is returned. If FALSE the EM algorithm is run for maxiter iterations and the parametrizations with the maximum likelihood encountered during the EM algorithm is returned. Default: TRUE, changed to FALSE if E="stochmax".
